DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of a serum immunofixation electrophoresis assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a serum immunofixation electrophoresis assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:An enhancement of immunoelectrophoresis in which a series of post-electrophoretic gel slabs are layered
with cellulose-acetate gels saturated with specific antibodies. The resulting antigen-antibody complexes fixed on the
second gel may then be stained, allowing sensitive and specific qualitative visual identification of paraproteins by
electrophoretic position. It can be used to identify specific proteins in the blood or urine. It has greatest application
in the identification and monitoring of monoclonal proteins that are produced in conditions like Waldenstom's
macroglobulinaemia and multiple myeloma
:Electrophoresis in which a polyacrylamide gel is used as the diffusion medium.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

An enhancement of immunoelectrophoresis in which a series of post-electrophoretic gel slabs are layered with cellulose-acetate gels saturated with specific antibodies. The resulting antigen-antibody complexes fixed on the second gel may then be stained, allowing sensitive and specific qualitative visual identification of paraproteins by electrophoretic position. It can be used to identify specific proteins in the blood or urine. It has greatest application in the identification and monitoring of monoclonal proteins that are produced in conditions like Waldenstom's macroglobulinaemia and multiple myeloma.

Analytical and separative procedures in which molecules, particularly proteins or nucleic acids, are separated by their different electrophoretic mobilities in a hydrated gel. The gel suppresses convective mixing of the fluid phase through which the electrophoresis takes place and contributes molecular sieving. For proteins, commonly carried out in the presence of the anionic detergent sodium dodecylsulphate (SDS). SDS denatures proteins so that noncovalently associating sub unit polypeptides migrate independently and by binding to the proteins confers a net negative charge roughly proportional to the chain weight.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
